        • Method Detail

          • @groovy.transform.PackageScope void applyConfig()

          • void defaultGems()

            Loads the default GEM installation directory and JAR installation directory

          • @Incubating void defaultMainClass()

            Makes the executable by adding a default main class

          • void defaults(java.lang.String... defs)

            Sets the defaults

            Parameters:
            defs - A list of defaults. Currently gems and mainClass are the only recognised values. Unrecognised values are silently discarded

          • @Incubating void extractingMainClass()

            Makes the executable by adding a default main class which extracts the jar to temporary directory

          • @InputDirectory void gemDir(java.lang.Object properties = [:], java.io.File f)

            Adds a GEM installation directory

          • void gemDir(java.lang.Object properties = [:], java.lang.Object dir)

            Adds a GEM installation directory

            Parameters:
            Properties - that affect how the GEM is packaged in the JAR. Currently only fullGem is supported. If set the full GEM content will be packed, otherwise only a subset will be packed.
            dir - Source folder. Will be handled by project.files(dir)

          • @Incubating void initScript(java.lang.Object scriptName)

          • @java.lang.Deprecated void jruby(groovy.lang.Closure cfg)

          • void jrubyMainsVersion(java.lang.String version)

          • void jrubyVersion(java.lang.String version)

          • JRubyJar.Type library()

          • @Incubating void mainClass(java.lang.String className)

            Makes the JAR executable by setting a custom main class

            Parameters:
            className - Name of main class

          • JRubyJar.Type runnable()
